page.title: 01GRIMSTHORPE CASTLE
page.content: Most of the local history is centred round Grimsthorpe castle.It is still a square shape.It has towers,it is a stone building,it has lots of windows.It is surrounded by landscape gardens,fields,woods and the lake.The lake is stocked with fish and local people say the odd tank or unexploded bomb.From the upper storeys the owner Baroness Willoughby de Eresby has seen all the area that we are studying.The main room is the Vanburgh Hall.The walls are lined with paintings.There are statues in the hall too.The Castle is open to the public on the 28th July for the summer season.On Christmas Eve Lady Willoughby invites villagers to a carol service because she is staying there with friends.There is a big log fire burning.Drinks are served and mince pies.
